katie muth

publications & projects

  • ‘Postmodernism and Its Discontents, Or, The Cultural Logic of Don DeLillo’ in Don DeLillo in Context, ed. Jesse Kavadlo (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2022)

  • World Literature and Dissent, eds. Lorna Burns and Katie Muth (London: Routledge, 2019)

  • ‘The Problem of Dissent’ in World Literature and Dissent

  • ‘Digital Readings’ in The New Pynchon Studies, ed. Joanna Freer (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2019)

  • ‘The Grammars of the System: Thomas Pynchon at Boeing’, Textual Practice 3.33 (2019): 473–493

  • ‘Nonfiction’ in Thomas Pynchon in Context, ed. Inger H. Dalsgaard (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2019)

  • ‘Mass Media’ in American Literature in Transition, 1950–1960, ed. Steven Belletto (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2018)

  • Translating Feminism Beta A beta KMZ map visualising the circulation and translation of second-wave feminist texts, drawn from data developed by the Leverhulme Trust funded International Network ‘Translating Feminism: Transfer, Transgression, Transformation (1945-1990)’ (University of Glasgow, 2016)

  • ‘Postmodern Fiction as Poststructuralist Theory: Kathy Acker’s Blood and Guts in High School’, Narrative 19.1 (January 2011): 88–112

dr katie muth
assistant professor of digital humanities and modern literature
